jobs.title: Business Development Intern analyst – Internship
jobs.description:
SharingOS is a global mobility sharing platform that provides plug-and-play solutions for the worldwide mobility market. SharingOS offers both hardware (bicycles, scooters, e-bikes, cars etc) and software (apps, fleet management etc) solutions, enabling partners to start their own mobility schemes from scratch.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial business development officer to join our business development team, preferably with 2+ years’ experience in a commercial environment. The role will be based in London, but with frequent contact with global partners in the Americas and Europe, as well as with the hardware and software team in China. 

Passion for the future of mobility is a prerequisite, knowledge of the commercial law is preferred, and an ability and desire to make new connections globally is critical. SharingOS’s differentiation comes from its partner-centric platform, so you must be open-minded, and want to work within a cross-culture cross-border environment.

You will be joining a small team and will be expected to hit the ground running. Ideally, you will have had experience with managing long-term projects, but the key traits we are looking for are an understanding of the commercial environment, and an ability to communicate clearly and build relationships with global partners.

Specifically, your role will be to:
- Work with and support the business development team
- Participate in meetings with prospects and existing partners
- Manage existing partner relationships and help to coordinate between the - hardware/software teams and global partners
- Project manage new tenders and new scheme launches

What we require:
- 2 + years’ experience in a commercial environment, ideally within a business development or relationship management. 
- MBA or postgraduate degrees in law is preferred
- An ability to communicate clearly and concisely
- Knowledge of commercial law is preferred
- Fluency in foreign languages would be desirable

What we offer:
- Opportunity to be a part of a leading and growing global mobility company
- A competitive compensation package & Startup perks
 

To apply, please send a cover letter and resume to careers@sharingos.com.

jobs.title: Finance Director
jobs.description:
Job Description

SharingOS is a global mobility sharing platform that provides plug-and-play solutions for the worldwide mobility market. SharingOS offers both hardware (bicycles, scooters, e-bikes, cars etc) and software (apps, fleet management etc) solutions, enabling partners to start their own mobility schemes from scratch. Currently, SharingOS are operating in 12 countries and 32 cities.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial and self-driven finance director to join our team, preferably with 3+ years’ experience in a commercial environment. The role will be based in London or Shanghai, but with frequent contact with global partners in the Americas and Europe, as well as with the hardware and software team in China.

Passion for the future of mobility is a prerequisite. SharingOS’s differentiation comes from its partner-centric platform, so you must be open-minded, and want to work within a cross-culture cross-border environment.

You will be expected to hit the ground running. Ideally you will have had experience with managing the finance function of a start-up, but the key traits we are looking for are an understanding of how to support, plan and manage the team for a fast-growing business.

Specifically, your role will be to: 
- Directly report to the CEO 
- Be in charge of finance and accounting functions
- Set up and control budget and business plan
- Help to propose and administrate the KPIs of different teams

What we require: 
- 3+ years’ experience in finance function of a startup
- Undergraduate degree in any subject. MBA or postgraduate degrees and accounting qualifications are preferred 
- An ability to communicate clearly and concisely 
- Fluency in foreign languages would be desirable (especially Mandarin Chinese)

What we offer: 
- Opportunity to be a part of a leading and growing global startup company 
- A competitive compensation package with a sales incentive scheme

To apply, please send a cover letter and resume to careers@sharingos.com.

Compensation:
GBP35k – 75k
Plus discretionary bonus and share options

jobs.title: Growth Manager
jobs.description:
We are seeking a highly-skilled, adaptable, and reliable Growth Manager to help take our company to the next level. In this position, you will be part of a dynamic team of professionals who plan and implement our sales, marketing, and advertising activities. You should be familiar with analysis and market research, product and service promotion, and anticipation of customer behaviour.

Duties and Responsibilities

• Manage daily social media and sales leads tasks
• Conduct market research and identify new opportunities.
• Gather and analyse client behaviour data (e.g. web traffic and rankings)
• Generate reports on marketing and sales metrics from Hubspot and google ads
• Contribute to collaborative efforts and organize promotional events
• Coordinate with the marketing design and content teams to generate digital and print advertising material
• Maintain and update impeccable records of marketing metrics and results of past campaigns
• Prepare and deliver regular sales forecasting reports
• Monitor and report competitors’ marketing and sales activities.

 Requirements and Qualifications

• BS degree in marketing or relevant field
• Successful work experience as a marketing associate, marketing assistant, or similar position
• Strong working knowledge of the marketing and sales industry, including digital tools and techniques
• Significant experience with SEO/SEM campaigns
• Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office suite, web analytics, and Google AdWords
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills
 
What you can get

• Competitive Salary
• Stock options
• Pension
• Flexible working hours
• Free daily snacks, coffee, treats and weekly pizza party
• Regular team socials and events
• Everyone from founder to intern can make a change in the business. If you’ve got a good idea, we’ll make it happen.

jobs.title: Partnerships Manager
jobs.description:
We are seeking a highly-skilled, adaptable, and reliable Partnerships Manager to help take our company to the next level. 

Duties and Responsibilities

•	Maintain contact with clients to obtain customer feedback regarding product/service quality
•	Assist clients in resolving issues and complaints concerning purchased products or services
•	Build and establish a good work relationship with clients to facilitate increased patronage and revenue
•	Monitor contract details to notify clients of pending expiration and help process renewal
•	Organise promotional and marketing campaigns to create awareness and product publicity
•	Supervise the operations of after-sales teams to ensure set targets are met
•	Develop and implement strategies effective for ensuring a satisfied clientele and increased returns
•	Liaise with sales departmental heads to discuss business plans necessary for enhancing sales performance
•	Direct and coordinate the customer service operation of a team to ensure clients are tended appropriately in line with set customer service standards
•	Develop and optimise support and service processes, tools, and systems
•	Conduct price and contract negotiations with clients to establish contract details and attain profit margin
•	Oversee all post-sales services provided to clients to ensure customer satisfaction
•	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of job operations by conducting research and participating in educational programs
•	Provide periodic reports to management on all after-sales activities
•	Ensure compliance with all general and company policies when carrying out job duties.

Requirements and Qualifications

•	Education and Training: Require a Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, economics, or in any other related business discipline. Prior experience in a management field, preferably customer relationship management is also necessary to secure the job
•	Communication Skills: adept at interacting with customers to identify and help meet their desires
•	Leadership Skills: coordinate and organise the activities of after-sales teams to ensure client satisfaction and improved sales
•	Problem-solving Skills: develop and implement solutions necessary to ensure increased patronage and customer satisfaction.

What you can get

•	Competitive Salary
•	Stock options
•	Pension
•	Flexible working hours
•	Free daily snacks, coffee, treats and weekly pizza
•	Regular team socials and events
•	Everyone from founder to intern can make a change in the business. If you’ve got a good idea, we’ll make it happen.
